discussion.p: LWG mention that there is no variable of function type. There's also no variable of void type, so should also explicitly say that for a void type T, is_constructible<T, Args...>::value is false?
Wed PM: Move to Tentatively Ready

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4594.

li.p: Change , Table 52 — "Type property predicates", as indicated:

td.tt:
template <class T, class... Args>
struct is_constructible;

tr.td:
For a function type T
or for a (possibly cv-qualified) void type T,
is_constructible<T, Args...>::value
is false, otherwise see below

T and all types in the
parameter pack Args shall
be complete types,
(possibly cv-qualified)
void, or arrays of
unknown bound.
